head.title: WEB SITE EXONERATED ON NAZI CONTENT

identified-content.classifier: Nazi Policies Toward Jews and Minorities
Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Technology, Telecommunications and Internet
Nazi Policies Toward Jews and Minorities

hedline.hl1: WEB SITE EXONERATED ON NAZI CONTENT

abstract.p: French court rules that French Internet access provider, Multimania, is not responsible for Web site, NSDAP, containing Nazi content; site was shut down earlier this year after learning that letters stood for Hitler's Nazi party (S)

block.p: Two days after a French court ruled that Yahoo had violated French law by allowing Nazi memorabilia to be sold on a Web site accessible through its American portal, another French court said a French Internet access provider, Multimania, was not responsible for a Web site containing Nazi content. A Paris court fined Yahoo on Monday and ordered its French subsidiary to make sites originating in the United States that auction Nazi memorabilia inaccessible in France. But a court in Nanterre, near Paris, said Multimania was not responsible for the content of a site, NSDAP, which it had shut down earlier this year after learning that the letters stood for Hitler's Nazi party.

Two days after a French court ruled that Yahoo had violated French law by allowing Nazi memorabilia to be sold on a Web site accessible through its American portal, another French court said a French Internet access provider, Multimania, was not responsible for a Web site containing Nazi content. A Paris court fined Yahoo on Monday and ordered its French subsidiary to make sites originating in the United States that auction Nazi memorabilia inaccessible in France. But a court in Nanterre, near Paris, said Multimania was not responsible for the content of a site, NSDAP, which it had shut down earlier this year after learning that the letters stood for Hitler's Nazi party.
